issues.description: The problem statement’s general instruction requires constructors to list attributes in the UML class box order (excellencyLevel then excellentEnough), but the solution’s ExcellenceLand constructor takes parameters in the order (rides, excellentEnough, excellencyLevel). This mismatch between the UML‐based ordering and the solution’s parameter order can confuse students when implementing the constructor.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify in the problem statement how to include and order the association attribute ‘rides’ in the constructor. Either update the UML to list ‘rides’ as the first attribute or adjust the general instruction to explicitly state that for ExcellenceLand the constructor signature should be (List<Ride> rides, boolean excellentEnough, double excellencyLevel).
